5 Modus Monopoli di Tol Laut Versi Kemenhub
01 Nov 2019, 22:22 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Direktur Lalu Lintas dan Angkutan Laut Kementerian Perhubungan Wisnu Handoko menduga ada lima modus monopoli pengiriman barang via tol laut oleh perusahaan swasta. Tindak penguasaan pasar itu melibatkan pengirim barang, penerima barang, dan agen pengurus pengiriman barang.
"Monopoli itu terjadi karena ada sebagian besar pihak yang dapat order container paling banyak," ujar Wisnu di kantornya, Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat, Jakarta Pusat, pada Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Pertama, secara rinci, modus monopoli itu dilakukan oleh pengirim atau shipper dan forwarder atau agen. Menurut Wisnu, keduanya diduga telah menguasai pemesanan kontainer pengiriman barang di sejumlah trayek.
Agar tidak terdeteksi melakukan penyelewengan, kedua pihak ini menggunakan nama yang berbeda-beda. Padahal, berdasarkan penelusuran Kementerian, pengirim dan agen ini merupakan satu entitas yang sama.
Modus kedua, Wisnu mensinyalir agen yang melakukan monopoli ini merangkap status sebagai penerima atau consignee. Karenanya, arus keluar-masuk barang yang dikirim via tol laut berasal dari satu pintu.
Dengan begitu, agen dapat mengatur harga barang. Selanjutnya, modus ketiga ialah perusahaan pelayaran atau operator hanya melayani satu hingga tiga agen dengan volume pengiriman paling tinggi. Kondisi ini berpengaruh pada harga barang.
"Karena agennya itu-itu saja, harga pasti cenderung tinggi karena tidak ada pilihan lain," ucap Wisnu.
Kemudian, keempat, Wisnu menduga masalah terjadi di sisi tenaga kerja bongkar muat atau TKBM. Menurut dia, selama ini hanya ada satu koperasi TKBM yang melayani pengiriman dan penerimaan barang di satu pelabuhan.
Lantaran tidak ada kompetisi TKBM, harga pengiriman barang di level tersebut dapat diatur oleh satu pihak. Ia mencontohkan ketika TKBM meminta biaya tambahan di luar anggaran kargo atau handling, masyarakat tak bisa berkutik.
"Karena kan tidak ada pilihan lain, mesti harus pakai TKBM itu. Kalau tidak mau membayar, nanti tidak dilayani," ucapnya.
Terakhir, Wisnu berpendapat masalah ini bersumber dari penerima barang. Menurut dia, beberapa penerima tidak menjual barang dengan harga murah meski telah memanfaatkan jasa tol laut. Akibatnya, masih tetap terjadi disparitas harga barang kendati pemerintah sudah memberikan subsidi.
Wisnu mencatat saat ini ada empat trayek pengiriman barang via tol laut yang berpotensi dimonopoli oleh perusahaan swasta. Keempatnya ialah trayek Tanjung Perak - Namlea, Tanjung Perak - Dobo, Tanjung Perak - Saumlaki, dan Tanjung Perak - Wasior.
Masalah monopoli tol laut sebelumnya sempat disinggung oleh Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi. Jokowi mengaku mendapat laporan ada monopoli perusahaan swasta soal tol laut. Ia menyayangkan hal ini lantaran program tol laut mendapat apresiasi dari masyarakat dan pemerintah daerah karena berhasil menurunkan inflasi dan harga barang.

FRANCISCA CHRISTY ROSANA

5 Ministry of Transportation's Monopoly Mode on Sea Toll
01 Nov 2019, 22:22 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Director of Traffic and Sea Transportation at the Ministry of Transportation Wisnu Handoko suspects that there are five modes of monopoly for the shipment of goods via sea tolls by private companies. The market control action involves the sender of goods, the recipient of goods, and the shipping agent.
"The monopoly happens because there are most parties who can order the most containers," Wisnu said in his office, Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat, Central Jakarta, on Friday, November 1, 2019.
First, in detail, the monopoly mode is carried out by the sender or shipper and forwarder or agent. According to Wisnu, both are suspected to have mastered the ordering of shipping containers in a number of routes.
In order not to be detected to commit fraud, the two parties use different names. In fact, based on tracking the Ministry, the sender and agent are one and the same entity.
The second mode, Vishnu indicated that the agent carrying out this monopoly doubles the status of a recipient or consignee. Therefore, the flow in and out of goods sent via the sea toll comes from one door.
That way, the agent can adjust the price of the goods. Furthermore, the third mode is the shipping company or operator serving only one to three agents with the highest shipping volume. This condition affects the price of the goods.
"Because of the same agents, prices tend to be high because there is no other choice," said Wisnu.
Then, fourthly, Wisnu suspected that the problem occurred in the loading and unloading workforce or TKBM. According to him, so far there has only been a TKBM cooperative serving shipping and receiving goods at one port.
Because there is no TKBM competition, the price of shipping goods at that level can be set by one party. He gave an example when TKBM asked for additional costs beyond the cargo or handling budget, the public could not move.
"Because there is no other choice, you have to use the TKBM. If you don't want to pay, you will not be served later," he said.
Finally, Wisnu believes that this problem originated from the recipient of the goods. According to him, some recipients do not sell goods at cheap prices even though they have used sea toll services. As a result, there is still a disparity in the price of goods despite the government providing subsidies.
Wisnu noted that currently there are four freight routes via sea tolls that have the potential to be monopolized by private companies. The four routes are the Tanjung Perak - Namlea, Tanjung Perak - Dobo, Tanjung Perak - Saumlaki, and Tanjung Perak - Wasior routes.
Previously, the sea monopoly toll problem was mentioned by President Joko Widodo or Jokowi. Jokowi said that he received a report that there was a monopoly by a private company about sea tolls. He regretted this because the sea highway program received appreciation from the community and local government for successfully reducing inflation and the price of goods.

FRANCISCA CHRISTY ROSANA
